main event: Multiple witnesses observed a bright, hovering light in the sky over Leighton, Alabama on September 6, 1950.
interesting points: The object was described as circular and approximately 15 to 50 feet in diameter.,Witnesses reported that the object hovered for several minutes before moving slowly to the northwest.,The object emitted a bluish-white light and was observed for about 15 minutes.,Several sightings were reported by different individuals, indicating a consistent description of the object.,The Air Force classified the incident as 'Unidentified' despite attempts to identify it as a weather balloon.
sighted object: a bright, circular object emitting a bluish-white light
witness description: Mr. R. B. Leighton and other local residents
